intro: Lachnostoma longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved lichen, is a foliose lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its flat, leaf-like thallus that is typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga, and a fungal component. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on bark or soil surfaces. Lachnostoma longifolium is commonly used in ecological studies to assess air quality due to its sensitivity to pollutants.
